text: This lets you choose between one of three heroic battlefields. Choose your favourite location and make a stand!
New to Total War: WARHAMMER, some characters have a selection of mounts and upgrades available to them. Selecting these icons will assign the chosen mount and upgrades for the battle ahead.
Seems that there is some furore around this event. Let the dust settle for a moment.

From here you can filter characters and choose at which date you would like to start your campaign. \\n\\n  {{tr:tw_3k_mandate}} \\n {{tr:tw_3k_main}}  \\n {{tr:tw_3k_a_world_betrayed}}  \\n {{tr:tw_3k_fate_of_the_emperor}} \\n {{tr:tw_3k_eight_princes}}

When one of your [[b]]spies[[/b]] is serving as a [[b]]general[[/b]]  in an [[b]]enemy army[[/b]]  and one of your armies engages them in the field, you may choose to [[b]]extract[[/b]]  the spy [[b]]before the battle[[/b]], thereby diminishing your opponent’s strength.Extracting your spy before a battle [[b]]costs money[[/b]] and requires that the spy possess a certain amount of [[b]]cover[[/b]] – and [[b]]undercover network[[/b]] – in the enemy faction.Simple [[b]]extraction[[/b]] will have your spy [[b]]disband[[/b]] their [[b]]retinue[[/b]] and [[b]]return to your faction[[/b]], diminishing the enemy’s strength.With [[b]]greater cover and undercover network[[/b]] at the spy’s disposal, you may order the spy to [[b]]extract and reinforce[[/b]], which orchestrates the [[b]]defection of their entire retinue[[/b]] to your cause, ready to [[b]]join you[[/b]] in the [[b]]upcoming battle[[/b]] and greatly disadvantaging the enemy!You may find that you would rather [[b]]wait[[/b]] for a more opportune moment and order your spy to [[b]]remain undercover[[/b]], or if you have misjudged the resources at your disposal you may not be able to afford to extract them; plan accordingly!
A sea trade route will link your two capitals.

This button allows you to initiate [[b]]duels[[/b]] with characters in an enemy alliance. Winning duels will have a significant impact on the morale of forces and can be a deciding factor in battle.\\n\\nPressing this button will show you a list of enemies you can [[b]]challenge[[/b]]. For a duel to occur, a challenge must be [[b]]accepted[[/b]], and in some cases, the enemy might [[b]]reject[[/b]] the challenge.\\n\\nFor each character you can challenge, the possible [[b]]outcome[[/b]] of the duel will be highlighted. Some duels are about life or death and will only conclude when one of the combatants falls, while others are merely concerned with demonstrating one's battle prowess, or about the honourable contest between duellists.\\n\\nBy default, other soldiers will respect a duel and will [[b]]not interfere[[/b]]. You can order units to attack the enemy duellist, but this will be seen as a [[b]]dishonourable[[/b]] act and will have a negative morale effect on your forces. However, it can be the only way to save your hero's life.\\n\\nYou can also [[b]]run away[[/b]] from an ongoing duel – an equally dishonourable act.\\n\\nBuffing your hero with other characters while a duel is ongoing is [[b]]not dishonourable[[/b]], however, and can be a strong strategy for improving your duellist.

This value shows the relative [[b]]destruction level[[/b]] of this settlement.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_destruction_level]][[/img]] [[b]]Destruction level[[/b]] increases when buildings are [[b]]set on fire[[/b]] and areas of the settlement are being [[b]]destroyed[[/b]].\\n\\nHigh levels of destruction will cause a [[b]]morale penalty[[/b]] for the defender.

This panel contains the list of Legacy Of Wu Ambitions sets. By clicking on any of them, you can read more about the individual ambitiont. Sets that have been completed will apear with an golden icon.\\n\\nAt the top of the panel is a search-bar and filter for "Completed", "In Process" or "Failed" sets.

This toggles the unit [[b]]info panel[[/b]]. Inspect this panel to review a unit's [[b]]statistics[[/b]] or [[b]]compare[[/b]] two units. Use the [[b]]tooltips[[/b]] on the info panel itself to understand each individual statistic.\\n\\nTo compare two units, [[b]]pin[[/b]] an info panel by selecting a unit, then mousing over a different one.

This is the status panel for an [[b]]ongoing duel[[/b]], which allows you to keep track of its [[b]]progress[[/b]] and [[b]]strength comparison[[/b]]. If your hero is falling behind, it might be best to [[b]]intervene[[/b]] or [[b]]withdraw[[/b]] from the duel.\\n\\n(Romance mode only) Also consider [[b]]buffing[[/b]] your duellist by using the [[b]]special abilities[[/b]] of other heroes in your army.

Dynasty mode will continue until either the end of Wave 30, 1 hour has passed, or all your heroes have fallen.\\n• The number of enemies left to kill or rout to complete the current wave.

These are a unit's or character's special abilities.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_context_formations]][[/img]] Units are able to enter [[b]]formations[[/b]] that provide tactical abilities for certain situations. Investigate the [[b]]tooltip[[/b]] of a given formation to learn more about them.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_special_ability]][[/img]] (Romance mode only) Characters can unlock powerful [[b]]special abilities[[/b]] that can change the course of battle. Depending on a character's background, they can cause [[b]]direct damage[[/b]], while other abilities are either [[b]]buffs[[/b]] for friendly troops, or [[b]]debuffs[[/b]] that can be used against the enemy.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_skirmish]][[/img]] [[b]]Skirmish[[/b]] mode is available to most [[b]]ranged units[[/b]]. It means that the unit will try to [[b]]stay away from enemies[[/b]] and will retreat if they come too close.
This minister cannot be trusted, so our representative should greak off all contact.

The [[b]]bandit network[[/b]] allows bandit factions to acquire bonuses and a variety of new units that will help shape their military and economic success throughout a campaign. \\n\\nEach node represents a group based within the associated province, establishing a connection to one of these groups takes time, and requires that you already have a connection to an adjacent group. If you own one of the regions, in the associated province, you will be able to expand your local bandit network more quickly. \\n\\nThere are four major groups, further sub-divided by the five elements:\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_outcasts_&_outlaws_axe]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_outcasts_&_outlaws_bow]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_outcasts_&_outlaws_shield]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_outcasts_&_outlaws_spear]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech__dlc05_outcasts_&_outlaws_sword]][[/img]] [[b]]Outcasts & Outlaws[[/b]] are the local bandit groups and other outsiders through which you will be able to increase your banditry income and reduce recruitment costs, as well as gain access to Han infantry, staple units and some that are particular to the major bandit clans.\\n\\n [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_clandestine_&_corrupt_magistrate_seal]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_clandestine_&_corrupt_fan]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_clandestine_&_corrupt_farmer_tools]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_clandestine_&_corrupt_industrial_tools]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_clandestine_&_corrupt_merchant_purse]][[/img]] [[b]]Clandestine & Corrupt[[/b]]: parties of otherwise more official individuals who operate outside the law will help you improve your administrative capabilities and your income from “traditional” sources, as well as grant you access to more elite units.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_tribes_&_tradition_desert]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_tribes_&_tradition_forest]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_tribes_&_tradition_mountain]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_tribes_&_tradition_river]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_tribes_&_tradition_rolling_hills]][[/img]] [[b]]Tribes & Tradition[[/b]] still carry a lot of influence along the fringes of China, scions of the downtrodden or forgotten who will help improve your military effectiveness and looting capabilities, as well as granting you access to unique tribal units.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_faith_and_folly_dragon]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_faith_and_folly_man]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_faith_and_folly_phoenix]][[/img]] , [[img:help_mode_tech_dlc05_faith_and_folly_tortoise]][[/img]] [[b]]Faith & Folly[[/b]] dictate the lives of many throughout the lands, from the remnants of the Yellow Turban rebellion and beyond; for all their unconventional principles, they can nonetheless help you maintain control of corruption and characters, as well as granting you access to some equally unconventional units.

China is wrought by chaos. The Han dynasty falls and tyrants rise. You are thrust into this madness by the whim of heaven, but what do you know of war? You are chosen to lead China, either to salvation or destruction. Let Total War begin!

This section allows you to select a hero and view or upgrade their abilities. The number on their portrait indicates how many available upgrade points they have to spend.\\n\\nIn a single-player battle you can select all heroes and purchase upgrades for all of them. In a multiplayer battle you can only select and upgrade your own hero.

Victory conditions:\\n\\nStandard: Defeat all other enemies, then become emperor and eliminate all other emperors by taking their seats of power. As the Yellow Turbans, this means destroying all factions loyal to the Han.\\n\\nCo-operative: combine your strength by signing a shared mandate diplomatic deal.\\n\\nHead-to-Head: destroy the other player or compete with one another to be the first to meet the victory conditions.

This menu allows you to customise the parameters of the battle itself – how big the units will be, the difficulty level, and how long the battle will last. You can also select whether or not to fight in Romance mode and turn on battle realism. You can also enable large armies, giving everyone in the battle access to more troops.\\n\\nCrucially, you can also begin the battle from here.
Toggle Loose Formation||Loose formation spreads units out, making them much harder to hit with missiles, but greatly reduces their ability to resist charges.

Use this area to review your forces in battle and keep an eye out for notifications.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_ability_timer]][[/img]] This is the [[b]]ability timer[[/b]] for this character's special abilities.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_retinue]][[/img]] This icon indicates which units belong to this character's [[b]]retinue[[/b]], or, when selecting a non-character, indicates the character that this unit [[b]]belongs to[[/b]].\\n\\n[[i]]Left-click to select a unit. Ctrl+left-click will allow you to select multiple units. Double left-click will zoom to the unit.\\n\\nPress Ctrl+# to create a control group incorporating all your selected units.[[/i]]

Your spy's attempts to ingratiate themselves have drawn the attention of one of their political rivals - having the ear of their lord, their requests were dismissed out of hand. Your agent can attempt to further press their case, but it could lead to their discovery.
[[b]]SIEGE ATTACKER[[/b]]\\n\\n This unit can attack gates or walls, allowing you to instantly launch a siege battle without having to wait for towers or battering rams to be built.
Drop Siege Equipment||Drops your current siege equipment.

Armour-piercing||The damage of armour-piercing weapons mostly ignores the target's armour, making them the ideal choice against heavily-armoured enemies. They often inflict less damage in total though, making them less efficient against weakly armoured targets.

This is a list of all of the active abilities that can be unlocked.\\n\\nThe number on the top right of each icon is the points cost to unlock it. Purchased abilities will be added to the section above. Any abilities unlocked here are permanently unlocked for the rest of the battle.\\n\\nActive abilities are effects that require player input to trigger. They typically cause great damage to targeted enemies and restore hit points to targeted allies. Hover over the ability icons for more details.
Your allies at war with each other!

These are general [[b]]commands[[/b]] for the units in your army.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_context_run]][[/img]] [[b]]Run speed[[/b]] is turned on by default. It can be worth [[b]]turning it off[[/b]], however, if you need to prevent units becoming [[b]]fatigued[[/b]] while traversing the map.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_context_halt]][[/img]] [[b]]Halt[[/b]] instantly [[b]]cancels all orders[[/b]] and makes a unit [[b]]stop[[/b]] all movement and attacks. This can be used to stop artillery from continuing to fire into a settlement during a siege battle.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_context_toggle_group]][[/img]][[b]]Toggle group[[/b]] generates a [[b]]control group[[/b]] incorporating all [[b]]selected units[[/b]].\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_context_guard]][[/img]][[b]]Guard mode[[/b]] can be activated to order a unit to [[b]]stand its ground[[/b]]. This means it will [[b]]not pursue[[/b]] its enemy but rather [[b]]defend[[/b]] its current position.\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_context_melee_mode]][[/img]] [[b]]Melee mode[[/b]] orders a unit to attack in melee instead of its ranged weapon. This can be useful to [[b]]conserve ammunition[[/b]], or if you want units to [[b]]charge[[/b]] into the enemy's ranks.

Moving up in an enemy faction is difficult, and made more so when your spy needs to keep their cover intact. A slightly dubious minister has offered to carry your agent's letter, if they explain the real reason why they want such a high position. Trusting them may be the only way up, but they may betray your spy.

Fealties represent the innate traditions and culture of the Nanman. They are assimilated from destroyed enemy factions, and shared between vassals and allies. Once a Fealty is gained, it can only be lost upon the death of the tribe. Gathering them all will unlock the last tiers of the Reforms tree, and set you on the path to ultimate victory!

This section lists the passive abilities that can be unlocked.\\n\\nThe number on the top-right of each icon is the points cost to unlock it. Purchased abilities will be added to the section above. Any abilities unlocked here will be permanently unlocked for the rest of the battle.\\n\\nPassive abilities are effects that automatically trigger when certain conditions are met. Hover over the ability icons for more details.

This section lists the active abilities you have unlocked for this hero.\\n\\nActive abilities are effects that require player input to trigger. Active abilities typically cause great damage to targeted enemies and restore HP to targeted allies. Hover over the ability icons for more details.

Victory in a settlement battle is determined by [[b]]victory points[[/b]].\\n\\n[[img:help_mode_battle_capture_points]][[/img]] Once the attacker is in control of the victory point by [[b]]capturing[[/b]] it with his own units, this number will start to [[b]]tick down[[/b]]. As long as the defender is in control of the victory point, this number will remain [[b]]static[[/b]].\\n\\nOnce this number [[b]]reaches 0[[/b]], the attacker has won the battle and captured the city.
